name: Magnesia phosphorica
Relationship: Antidotes: BELL.; GELS.; LACH.Compare: KALI-PHOS.; COLOCY.; SILICA; ZINC.; DIOS.

Eyes: Eyes hot, tired, vision blurred, colored lights before eyes
Supraorbital pains; worse, right side; relieved by warmth applied externally
Fever: CHILLS RUN UP AND DOWN THE BACK, WITH SHIVERING, followed by a suffocating sensation
Stomach: Hiccough, with retching day and night
Mind: Laments all the time about the pain
Abdomen: Constipation in rheumatic subjects due to flatulence and indigestion
BLOATED, FULL SENSATION IN ABDOMEN; MUST LOOSEN CLOTHING, WALK ABOUT, AND CONSTANTLY PASS FLATUS
FLATULENT COLIC, FORCING PATIENT TO BEND DOUBLE; RELIEVED BY RUBBING, WARMTH, PRESSURE; ACCOMPANIED WITH BELCHING OF GAS, WHICH GIVES NO RELIEF
Respiratory: Voice harsh, larynx sore and raw
SPASMODIC COUGH, with difficulty in lying down
Mouth: Ulceration of teeth, with swelling of glands of face, throat and neck, AND SWELLING of tongue
TOOTHACHE; BETTER BY HEAT AND HOT LIQUIDS
Head: Vertigo on moving, falls forward on closing eyes, better walking in open air
Sensation as if contents were liquid, as if parts of brain were changing places, as of a cap on head
Aches after mental labor, with chilliness; always better warmth
Throat: Soreness and stiffness, especially right side; parts seem puffy, WITH CHILLINESS, and aching all over
Extremities: Weakness in arms and hands, finger-tips stiff and numb
Ears: SEVERE NEURALGIC PAIN; worse behind right ear; worse, by going into cold air, and WASHING FACE AND NECK WITH COLD WATER

details: The great anti-spasmodic remedy. Cramping of muscles with radiating pains. Neuralgic pains RELIEVED BY WARMTH. Especially suited to tired, languid, exhausted subjects. Indisposition for mental exertion. Goitre.
dosage: First to twelfth potency. Sometimes the highest potencies are preferable. Acts especially well, given in hot water.
